arm_group.description: Reading newspaper of the day : single 20-minutes session

brief_summary.textblock:
Cigarette craving usually occurs with unpleasant feelings, including stress. Progressive
      Muscle Relaxation (PMR) may reduce level of cigarette craving and/or withdrawal symptoms.

clinical_study.brief_title: Progressive Muscle Relaxation and Cigarette Craving

detailed_description.textblock:
The study reports on a study investigating the acute effects of a one-time application of
      progressive muscle relaxation on craving for cigarettes in smokers who were instructed to
      abstain from cigarettes for 3 hours.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Age 18 years or more

          -  Daily cigarette smokers

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Hospitalization

          -  Participating in cigarette dependency treatment or trying to quit smoking with other
             methods

          -  Uncontrolled blood pressure

          -  Current other substance users (except alcohol)

intervention.description: Comparison of progressive muscle relaxation and no intervention (e.g., reading newspaper of the day) for the same amount of time.

facility.name: Department of Psychiatry, Faculty of Medicine, Chulalongkorn University

clinical_study.official_title: Preliminary Study of Effects of Progressive Muscle Relaxation on Cigarette Craving and Withdrawal Symptoms of Experienced Smokers in Acute Cigarette Abstinence : A Randomised Control Trial

other_outcome.description: Systolic and diastolic blood pressure, measured by an automated machine
other_outcome.time_frame: Immediately after a 20-minutes session of progressive muscle relaxation

other_outcome.description: Pulse rate, measured by an automated machine
other_outcome.time_frame: Immediately after a 20-minutes session of progressive muscle relaxation

primary_outcome.description: Craving, a strong desire for using a substance when abstaining from substance, was measured by the Penn Alcohol Rating Scale - adapted (PACS-adapted) and the Visual Analog Scale (VAS).
primary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately after a 20-minutes session of progressive muscle relaxation

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Cigarette withdrawal symptoms (i.e., anxious, hungry, feeling bad, restless) and non-withdrawal (i.e., high, stimulated, paranoid, tongue - tied) (59-61), as measured by using the Visual Analog Scale (VAS)
secondary_outcome.measure: Cigarette withdrawal-related and non-withdrawal related feelings
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately after a 20-minutes session of progressive muscle relaxation

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
